overallImpression: Premium, polished design with dark navy (#0E1235) and gold (#C5943A) palette. Montserrat headings convey architectural authority, Merriweather body font adds sophistication. Warm cream background (#F5F3EF) complements the gold accent without competing. Hero sections feature luxury property renders with strong overlay contrast. ValueStrip, trust badges, Google review widget, service cards with location targeting, area coverage grid, trust cards, gallery, FAQ accordion, and CTA banner all execute the luxury positioning consistently.

checks.detail: Primary #0E1235 applied to header, footer, ValueStrip, CTA banner backgrounds. Accent #C5943A applied to CTA buttons, active nav links, Learn More links, gold underline accents, and Google badge stars.

Montserrat used for all headings (H1 hero, H2 sections, H3 service cards, nav items). Merriweather used for body text, descriptions, and paragraph content. Consistent across homepage, services, and about pages.

Layout uses responsive Tailwind grid classes. Service cards stack on smaller viewports. Hero text scales appropriately. Viewport meta tag present. MobileActionBar component present with phone and WhatsApp CTAs.

Hero section prominent on all three pages with full-width background image, clear H1 heading, supporting text, and dual CTA buttons (Call Now gold filled + View Our Services outlined). Google review badge (4.8 stars, 22 reviews) visible above heading. YearsBadge (10+ Years Serving Durban) positioned at bottom-left of hero.

White text on dark navy (#0E1235) backgrounds provides excellent contrast. Hero text overlay has sufficient background darkening. Gold accent (#C5943A) on navy meets WCAG AA standards. Dark navy on cream (#F5F3EF) provides strong body text readability.

Hero images are high resolution luxury property renders. Service card images (construction, nutec houses, paving, tiling, awnings, cladding) render cleanly without pixelation. Gallery section has 6 project images including real construction photos and 3D renders. Logo renders crisply at all sizes.

Sticky navigation bar consistent across all pages: logo left, centered nav links (Home, Services, About Us, Reviews, Contact), phone CTA button right in gold pill shape. Active page highlighted in gold (#C5943A). Phone number (081 000 9096) always visible.

Footer includes Plan Elite logo, company description (NHBRC & SACAP registered), Quick Links (Home, Services, About Us, Reviews, Contact, Privacy Policy), Services listing with Durban area targeting, Contact Us (phone, WhatsApp, email, physical address at 58 Inanda Rd Waterfall). Copyright bar with registration details and founding year (2016).

CTA banner section present with 'Get Your Free Quote Today' heading, supporting text, and three large contact action buttons: Call Now (gold), WhatsApp (green), Email Us (navy). Prominent placement between FAQ and footer.

ValueStrip visible below hero on navy (#0E1235) background with three propositions: Free Consultation / No Obligation, NHBRC Registered / Full Warranty, Turnkey Projects / Plans to Keys. Trust badges row follows with NHBRC Registered, SACAP Accredited, 10+ Years Experience, 4.8 Google Rated.

Homepage and about page have clear H1 > H2 > H3 hierarchy. Service hub and inner pages use H1 for page title. Minor: the 'Why Durban Trusts Plan Elite' trust card headings (H3) use similar visual weight to section headings (H2), which slightly flattens the visual hierarchy.

Desktop spacing well balanced across all homepage sections (hero, ValueStrip, trust badges, reviews, services grid, areas, trust cards, gallery, FAQ, CTA banner). Minor: the transition between FAQ section and CTA banner section could use slightly more vertical padding for breathing room on smaller viewports.

warnings.detail: Homepage and about page have clear H1 > H2 > H3 hierarchy. Service hub and inner pages use H1 for page title. Minor: the 'Why Durban Trusts Plan Elite' trust card headings (H3) use similar visual weight to section headings (H2), which slightly flattens the visual hierarchy.

Desktop spacing well balanced across all homepage sections. Minor: the transition between FAQ section and CTA banner section could use slightly more vertical padding for breathing room on smaller viewports.
